title: Ticket #5859: Speed negotiation by ignoring job ranks
description:
Currently, when we match a job, we try to match it to every possible machine, in order to then sort all the matches by NEGOTIATOR_PRE_JOB_RANK, JOB_RANK, and NEGOTIATOR_POST_JOB_RANK. So, if there 1,000 slots available, and 20 submitters, we notionally attempt 20,000 matches, even if each submitter is only allowed 50 matches.

This patch adds a new knob, NEGOTIATOR_IGNORE_JOB_RANKS, which assumes that job ranks are independent of the job, and sorts the machines once, and only attempts to make as many matches as the submitter limit allows.

We believe this may make a significant improvement in negotiation speed for cms.
remarks:

Note that we aren't going to document this one just yet, until we can verify that there's a good speedup, and to see if we can automatically enable this, when appropriate.
